summary: An email from an Associate U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York instructing recipients to preserve all documents, emails, hard-copy notes, and text messages related to Jeffrey Epstein's conditions of confinement and suicide. The email is addressed to multiple parties and copied to senior prosecutors.

persons.name: Strauss, Audrey
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) of an email from an Associate U.S. Attorney regarding the preservation of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide and conditions of confinement.

persons.name: Berman, Geoffrey
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) of an email from an Associate U.S. Attorney regarding the preservation of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide and conditions of confinement.

events.title: Document Preservation Request for Epstein Suicide
events.description: An Associate U.S. Attorney sends an email requesting the preservation of all documents, emails, hard-copy notes, and text messages related to Jeffrey Epstein's conditions of confinement and suicide.

keyFacts: The email is a formal document preservation request related to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide and conditions of confinement.
It specifically requests preservation of emails, hard-copy notes, and text messages from recipients.
The request comes from an Associate U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York and is copied to senior prosecutors Audrey Strauss and Geoffrey Berman.
The email indicates an investigation or review into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death was underway as of August 12, 2019.
The sender notes that emails are preserved by a 'regular three-year backup' system but requests explicit confirmation from recipients.
